title: My League of Legends has stopped opening (Mac)
body: I have recently not been able to open my league of legends, as soon as i click the icon.. it pops up in my dock for less than 1 second. Then disappears, someone please help meeeeeeeeeeeeee

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you try the following for me.

* Open a new Finder window, navigate to your Applications folder, and find League of Legends.app
  * Right click, Show Package Contents
* Double click on Contents, then LOL, then RADS, then system.
* Keep this window open for a bit.

* Re-download the League Of Legends OCE.dmg (https://signup.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload) install file.
* Open the file. A window will appear with a picture of Ryze, a League of Legends.app file, and a shortcut to your Applications folder.
* Right click on League of Legends.app, Show Package Contents.
* Double click on Contents, then LOL, then RADS, then system.
* There's a file in here called UserKernel.app, and you want copy it to the other window you have open. Do this by clicking and dragging the file, then dropping it into the other window.
* Verify that the UserKernel.app file now exists in the first window, the one showing the contents of your patched client.
* Assuming everything is ok, close the first Finder window, then switch back to the second window, the one showing the contents of the install file.
* Hit cmd+e to eject the disk image.

* Open a new Finder window, navigate to your Applications folder, and open the game. It should now run.
Hi I have been having the same problem. I just tried everything in your comment twice, and it has not worked. Do you have any other ideas as to why?
